intro: Lindernia pustulosa, commonly known as the pustular lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Lindernia pustulosa is a perennial herb that is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
